image.altText: An elderly man wearing glasses sits with fingers interlaced together over a table top

props.synopsis: A nursing home resident known to wander and ingest foreign objects died after choking on ribbons at a facility in Adelaide’s north, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Man 'choked to death' on ribbons and food in nursing home, inquest told

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: SA Police says it is investigating an employee's social media posts, after they allegedly made a post celebrating the assassination of the US right-wing political activist Charlie Kirk.

title.children: SA Police investigating social media post allegedly made by employee celebrating death of Charlie Kirk

image.altText: Susan Goodwin smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: SA Police and the Australian Federal Police (AFP) have launched a renewed investigation to find the remains of missing Port Lincoln woman, Susan Goodwin, who authorities believe was murdered.

title.children: SA Police and AFP launch renewed search for suspected murder victim in Port Lincoln

image.altText: A blue banded bee buzzes over a flower.

props.synopsis: A pollination ecologist says it is important people play their part in preserving feral and native bees.

title.children: Residents encouraged to attract more bees as varroa mite spreads

image.altText: Aerial image of Andgar's Dublin piggery in South Australia taken by drone in June 2025.

props.synopsis: The Department of Primary Industries and Regions says about 200 animals died in the blaze while another 45 pigs were euthanised by the department and RSPCA.

title.children: Hundreds of pigs die after SA piggery catches fire

image.altText: Two female students in grey uniforms look at a laptop on a table

props.synopsis: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

title.children: AI app rolls out in SA schools as tech experts warn against 'dumbing down'

image.altText: The 'pass go' square on a monopoly game board.

props.synopsis: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

title.children: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: The actions of a man who imported a child-like sex doll to his family home have been labelled "morally and legally repugnant" by a District Court judge.

title.children: Man jailed until at least 2028 for importing child-like sex doll

image.altText: A portrait photo of Max Basheer.

props.synopsis: Max Basheer — the football administrator who oversaw the creation of the Adelaide Crows and the purpose-built stadium Football Park — has died aged 98.

title.children: 'SA giant' who championed entry of Crows, Port into the AFL remembered

image.altText: Soldier flood waters

props.synopsis: A dedicated disaster recovery force is needed, or else responders and defence forces could be "overwhelmed" by multiple concurrent natural disasters, the National Climate Risk Assessment warns.

title.children: Dedicated disaster force needed to prevent ADF being overwhelmed: report

image.altText: Jacinta Allan gets a selfie with delegation in China

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan's one week trip to the Middle Kingdom is a show with two audiences, as she eyes Chinese investment and hopes to solidify her party's relationship with Chinese Victorians.

title.children: The Victorian premier's trip to China hopes to generate selfies and trade

image.altText: A greyscale satellite image of a boat moving in dark waters, surrounded by green and blue 'UNCLASSIFIED' markings

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is using the US military to bomb boats suspected of carrying drugs in international waters. But little is known about who is being killed, and military and legal experts are raising several red flags.

title.children: Trump's deadly 'war' with cartels could backfire in several ways, experts say

image.altText: A car drives past a protest banner.

props.synopsis: The state government approves the development of a $453 million energy storage system by a Chinese company in the state's north-east, angering nearby residents who say their concerns have been ignored.

title.children: Regional battery project green-lit by Vic premier during trip to China

image.altText: Soldiers in camo lean next to a vehicles holding guns.

props.synopsis: Australia and Papua New Guinea will be legally obliged to defend each other from a military attack on either territory under a landmark defence treaty, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'Battle ready': Australia and PNG will be obliged to defend each other under treaty

image.altText: A man sits on the side of a garden bed in front of a mural depicting the Union Jack.

props.synopsis: On the foreshore of Papua New Guinea's capital city, Ela Beach is where locals come to exercise, mingle and unwind at the end of a long day. But it wasn't always this way.

title.children: Before PNG gained independence, it was a colony of Australia

image.altText: Gas leak at Sydney restaurant 2025-09-16 10:09:00

props.synopsis: One person has died and several others, including police officers, are receiving medical treatment after a gas leak at a restaurant in north-west Sydney.

title.children: One dead, seven hospitalised after gas leak at Sydney restaurant

image.altText: A white and green China Coast Guard ship sails through calm blue seas.

props.synopsis: China's coastguard has accused Philippine ships of illegally entering China's territorial waters at a shoal that is internationally recognised to be with the Philippines exclusive economic zone.

title.children: Chinese vessels clash with Philippine boats at disputed shoal

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: Mother-of-two Elise Turner says she was asked to leave the Virgin Australia business lounge after refusing to go to a bathroom to pump breast milk.

title.children: Virgin Australia apologises after breastfeeding mum ejected from lounge

image.altText: A traffic warden holds up a flag reading 'Stop Children Crossing' in front of cars.

props.synopsis: About 800 educational facility attendants across the state — including ground staff, kitchen workers and cleaners — will walk off the job to protest increasing workloads and a funding agreement that has not increased in 28 years.

title.children: 'Unexpected' Tasmanian school closures as staff protest conditions

image.altText: A police vehicle spraying protesters with water.

props.synopsis: Months before anti-immigrant unrest broke out on the streets of London, it erupted in this small UK town.

title.children: Before London erupted, this UK town burnt migrants out of their homes

image.altText: A woman faces a man in a room. Both are in silouhette.

props.synopsis: A Goodstart worker who allegedly abused toddlers at a Ballarat centre speaks out for the first time and says he is appealing after being banned from working with children.

title.children: Childcare worker speaks out after being accused of abusing toddlers

image.altText: An older woman, white-haired looks out from behind metal a metal gatye in front of a brick building.

props.synopsis: The 81-year-old woman is charged with attempting to assist suicide, trafficking and possession of dangerous drugs, and the sale of potential harmful things.

title.children: Gold Coast pensioner accused of selling euthanasia drugs granted bail

image.altText: A man with long grey hair tied into a ponytail looks down at a mobile phone he's holding in his hands.

props.synopsis: The Plymouth Brethren Christian Church is fiercely protective of a multi-billion-dollar business which supports the church. These men found out the extraordinary lengths it will take to keep it safe.

title.children: David was told to find an ex-member of the secretive Brethren. He told them to run

image.altText: A close up of a man with curly hair and a stubbly beard, looking off-camera.

props.synopsis: Less than a week ago, Craig McLachlan was announced to play Colonel Mustard in the forthcoming national tour, making his return to the theatre after The Rocky Horror Show.

title.children: Craig McLachlan drops out of Cluedo stage show following backlash

image.altText: A composite of two images: one of a mannequin in a hat, hoodie and puffer jacket, and one of an older woman.

props.synopsis: Police search for clothing connected to the death of Diane Harkess, who they now believe was murdered before her Bateau Bay unit went up in flames last month.

title.children: Woman, 77, may have been murdered before suspicious Central Coast fire

image.altText: a woman holding a cup of tea

props.synopsis: Albany woman Debby Butler says she had to ask strangers to help her to the bathroom after Rex delayed her flight home from Perth Airport and left her without a wheelchair.

title.children: Wheelchair user left to fend for herself during six-hour Rex flight delay

image.altText: Bankstown Hospital nurses Ahmad Rashad Nadir, left, and Sarah Abu Lebdeh, right, leaning in to screen

props.synopsis: Sarah Abu Lebdeh appeared in a video chat with an Israeli content creator that allegedly included threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: Sydney nurse fired over video with Israeli influencer has charge dropped

image.altText: A man in a blue, with black hair, a beard and glasses shirt looks into the distance

props.synopsis: Simon Lviev, 34, rose to notoriety after a pattern of romance fraud and financial crimes, with victims scammed out of an estimated $15 million.

title.children: The Tinder Swindler, made famous by Netflix, arrested in Georgia

image.altText: Robert Reti crosses his arms and looks down outside Perth District Court.

props.synopsis: A male childcare worker indecently touched two young girls in his care at separate childcare centres in the Perth metropolitan area, a court hears.

title.children: Perth childcare worker accused of indecent dealing with two young girls

props.synopsis: Donald Trump signs a memorandum to send the National Guard into Memphis to combat crime, setting up another major test of his presidential power.

title.children: Trump signs order to send National Guard into Memphis

image.altText: Man and woman seated in dark stadium

props.synopsis: The first golden group of inductees were honoured at an event that threw back to the Sydney 2000 games with Nikki Webster reproducing her iconic opening ceremony performance.

title.children: Sydney Olympics heroes and Nikki Webster mark 25 year since Games

image.altText: The youth justice minister looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Three chiefs of staff have left Gold Coast MP Laura Gerber's office since the LNP was elected almost 11 months ago.

title.children: Questions raised after Qld minister goes through three chiefs of staff in a year

image.altText: Lisa Cook speaking at a board room meeting.

props.synopsis: The ASX gained ground on Tuesday, while markets now have greater certainty about the make-up of the US Federal Reserve board for this week's key rates meeting. Look back on the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Cook and Miran set for Fed rates meeting, ASX gains — as it happened

image.altText: old hand holding cash money notes with a list of bills on a notebook, calculator, glasses, lace tablecloth and cup of coffee

props.synopsis: Certain Centrelink payments will be increasing with inflation from Saturday. Check to see if you're affected.

title.children: Pension rates to increase over the weekend
